column1:
the main functionality of the idm user management api is to manage user information, including creating, updating, and getting details of users. the api allows for user management in several applications, including cribis, gemini authentication and authorization system (gas), and others. the api is not connected to idm via active directory, and every operation has different application orchestration described in diagrams under every operation and stored in git. the api endpoints include get /idm/user/v1/users to get all users, post /idm/user/v1/users to create new users, get /idm/user/v1/users/{identifier} to get a user detail, put /idm/user/v1/users/{identifier} to update information about a user, put /idm/user/v1/users/{identifier}/statuses to enable or disable a user, and put /idm/user/v1/users/{identifier}/passwords to change or reset a user password. 

based on the above information, the idm user management api falls under the category of "client".

based on the api summary, the main functionality and purpose of the api is to provide resources to help resolve consumer queries about payment accounts enabled through the mastercard digital enablement service. the api allows issuers to display customized messages per token within the apple pay wallet, search for tokens based on account pan, alternate account identifier, token unique reference, token, payment app instance id or comment id, retrieve the overall system status of the mastercard digital enablement service, activate a token for a digitization that has been approved and provisioned, retrieve the available activation methods for a token that is awaiting activation, retrieve all comments associated with a token, delete a token so that it may not initiate any new transactions, trigger the process of generating and sending a new activation code to the cardholder via the requested activation method, request that the mobile pin for a mastercard cloud-based payment token in a single issuer wallet is reset, retrieve the historical statuses and lifecycle events for a token, suspend an active token so that it may not initiate any new transactions, unsuspend or resume a suspended token and return it to the active state, update account pan mapping information or issuer product configuration id associated to a provisioned token, retrieve transactions performed by a token, and update the token assurance level after an issuer has performed additional cardholder authentication to indicate an increased level of token assurance. based on this information, the api can be classified under the "banking" category.
